thread.title: High schools: Outside the box, Oct. 22
thread.title_full: High schools: Outside the box, Oct. 22 - San Antonio Express-News

author: Terrence Thomas By Terrence Thomas, Staff WriterStaff writer
title: High schools: Outside the box, Oct. 22
text:
Photo: Billy Calzada /San 1 of / 1 1 Clemens team members hold up their trophy after defeating Laredo Alexander for the Region IV-6A championship at the UTSA Convocation Center on March 7, 2015. Clemens team members hold up their trophy after defeating Laredo Alexander for the Region IV-6A championship at the UTSA Convocation Center on March 7, 2015. Photo: Billy Calzada /San Antonio Express-News High schools: Outside the box, Oct. 22 1 / 1 Back to Gallery From inside the lines to out, Express-News staff writer Terrence Thomas takes a look back and a look ahead at the high school sports landscape:
Figure this
5: Days until the UIL permits high school boys basketball teams across the state to conduct their first after-school workout. The first day of the season is Nov. 16, and the UIL state tournament is scheduled for March 10-12 at the Alamodome .
9: Straight District 30-3A championships won by the Dilley boys cross country team. The Wolves won their latest title Monday, paced by Noe Garcia’s first-place finish. All five of Dilley’s runners placed in the top nine.
40: Wins this season for the Holy Cross volleyball team after Wednesday’s victory over Providence. The Knights became the 10th area school to record a 40-win season, joining Alamo Heights, Churchill, Incarnate Word, Johnson, La Vernia, New Braunfels, O’Connor, Poth and Reagan.
2006: The last time South San advanced to the UIL state volleyball playoffs before earning a berth this season. Under first-year coach Evelyn Pineda , a Holmes graduate and a former UTSA player, the Bobcats (16-14, 6-2) are tied for second place in District 28-6A, one game out of first with two league matches left. South San was 4-46 in district play during the five seasons before Pineda’s arrival.
